info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued August 24 at 5:11AM AKDT until August 24 at 11:00AM AKDT by NWS Juneau AK
info.description:
* WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. For the Heat Advisory, temperatures up to 80 expected.
* WHERE...Prince of Wales Island.
* WHEN...Until 7 PM AKDT this evening.
* IMPACTS...Individuals not accustomed to these unusually hot temperatures for this region may experience heat related illnesses Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will warm to around 80 degrees Sunday afternoon.
info.instruction:
Drink plenty of fluids and check up on elderly and vulnerable relatives and neighbors.
Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances as vehicle interiors can reach extreme temperatures in as little as 10 minutes
Take extra precautions when working in the sun. Wear sunscreen and lightweight, loose fitting clothing. Try to limit strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Take action when you see symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke
Close curtains during the daytime to reduce sun insulation into the home and open windows at night to allow the home to cool off. Utilize fans or community buildings with air conditioning.
If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.

parameter.value: DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM AKDT THIS MORNING... ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AKDT THIS EVENING
